photos.caption: Dollar spot lesions with characteristic hourglass-shaped tan bands on the leaf blade
Dollar spot patches on a bentgrass putting green — small, silver-dollar-sized sunken spots
Brown patch showing the characteristic smoke ring border visible in morning dew
Rhizoctonia leaf lesion with tan center and dark brown margin on tall fescue
Pythium blight — greasy, water-soaked patches that collapse rapidly in hot humid conditions
Cottony mycelium of Pythium visible in early morning dew on affected turf
Summer patch ring patterns on Kentucky bluegrass — bronze to straw-colored circular patches
Frog-eye pattern — green grass surviving in the center of summer patch rings
Anthracnose on annual bluegrass green — irregular yellow patches thinning during summer stress
Anthracnose leaf lesion with black acervuli (fruiting bodies) visible on the leaf blade
Gray leaf spot lesions on perennial ryegrass — olive-green to brown spots with twisted leaves
Type I fairy ring showing a distinct ring of dead or wilted turf on the green
Spring dead spot — circular bleached patches in bermudagrass during spring green-up
Take-all root rot (patch) — bronze, irregular declining patches on bentgrass green
Large patch on zoysiagrass — orange-brown circular patches expanding from the perimeter
Red thread — pink to red mycelium visible at leaf tips on perennial ryegrass
Pink snow mold (Microdochium patch) — circular patches with white to pink mycelium after snow melt
Bipolaris leaf spot lesions — dark brown spots with tan centers on Kentucky bluegrass blades
Necrotic ring spot — circular rings of dead grass with surviving green centers on bluegrass
Rust pustules — orange-yellow spore masses on grass blades that rub off on shoes and mowers
